pull.title: Update links to Qt
pull.body: Now that Qt resides at qt-project.org we should update old qt links to point there.

events.body: ACK except for Qt version change

events.message:
Update Bugreport Links

Update Qt Links

Revert Qt source link

Update Qt links

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -108,8 +108,8 @@ FreeDesktop notification interface through DBUS using the following qmake option
 Generation of QR codes
 -----------------------
 
-libqrencode may be used to generate QRCode images for payment requests. 
-It can be downloaded from http://fukuchi.org/works/qrencode/index.html.en, or installed via your package manager. Pass the USE_QRCODE 
+libqrencode may be used to generate QRCode images for payment requests.
comments.body: Perhaps I'm blind, where is the change here ^^?

This change is IMO a deeper one, as current release are still build with Qt 4.7.x. I would also love to see us switch to a newer version, but at least I (using Windows) can currently not work with 4.8.3 because of a qmake bug they introduced. 4.8.2 works pretty good and is used by the pull tester afaik, so 4.8.2 seems to be rather matured!
Please don't change the qt version without updating the gitian win32 scripts, I'd prefer to do this in a different pull.
